intro: Pterostelma albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecrop, is a species of succulent plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae, which includes many other succulent species. Pterostelma albiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
